steps.text: Mix all dry ingredients together and set aside
Whisk all wet ingredients well (except for shredded carrot)
Mix dry into wet (roughly) and add shredded carrot to incorporate
Bake at 350 for 24 mins
Fry onions, cabbage, 1 Tbsp oil in a wok until softened
Add in ground meat, soy sauce and zucchini and fry until cooked
In a separate frying pan, fry 1 Tbsp of oil with black bean sauce and oyster sauce for 3 mins
Combine sauce with veggie / meat and then add 1.5 cups of water and cook for 3 mins . At this point, add in raw defrosted shrimp
Combine corn starch with 1/4 cup water , add to sauce and cook until combined , add sugar to taste
Pour sauce on ramen / udon noodles and serve with cucumber
Slice chicken breasts in half lengthwise to get 4 thinner pieces
Salt each side of breast with salt and leave at room temperature for 15 mins
Cover all sides with pesto and rest for another 5 mins
Place pieces in air fryer on parchment pepper and cook at 390F for 8 mins or until internal temperature reaches 160
chop onion very finely
mix all ingredients together by hand and shape into 18 balls
air fry at 390 (Air fry temp setting) for 10-minutes
soak noodles in warm water for 2 minutes until softened then rinse with cold water and set aside
cube tofu into small pieces, mix with a bat of sauce and corn satarch then air fry for 12 minutes
stir-fry veggies (except onion, garlic and bean sprouts) until tender and set aside
stir fry eggs. set aside
stir fry garlic and onions until softened. Add noddles, oil and rest of sauce and cook until done
add in toppings (bean sprouts, cilantro, crushed peanuts and lime juice)
dice veggies . mince garlic
brown meat in instant pot with oil. Add vegetables and spices to pot and brown
make umami mix: broth with fish sauce, reduced soy sauce and cocoa powder
deglaze the pot with umami mix
to the pot: add beans, rest of umami mix, sweet potato and stir everything to combine
add tomatoes and tomato paste on top. DO NOT STIR
cook at high pressure for 15 mins with full natural release
Cook on saute for about 5 minus to reduce to desired consistency. Serve on top of rice with some shredded cheese
combine salad dressing components (except the cucumber and chopped cilantro) and set aside
roughly cut cucumber (cut in half first) then diagonally into bite sized pieces and then smash those pieces
toss everything to combine

title: Peanut Satay Ramen (with mushroom and tofu)

steps.text: In a medium-large pot, add some oil to the pot and then stir fry the ginger and garlic together, followed by mushrooms and crumbled extra firm tofu. Sauté for 5 minutes
Add peanut butter and 4 cups of veggie stock to deglaze the pot - add shrimp. Then leave uncovered and boil for 5 minutes
For each serving bowl, add in the following: 0.5 tbsp Cane sugar, 0.5 tsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp soy sauce and 0.5 tsp sesame oil and then whisk to combine
Boil ramen noodles (2 servings) as per instructions. Add bok choy (Sliced) at the same time so that they cook as well (boil for 4 minutes top). Drain
To the serving bowl (with soy mixture) , add in one serving of ramen noodles and top with 1/2 of prepared broth
top with chili oil, sesame seeds, chopped cilantro, crushed peanuts and enjoy
Mince raw shrimp very finely
Mix all filling ingredients very well by hand
make wontons by filling each wrapper with about 1 tbsp of filing , folding the wonton wrapper so that you form a triangle, bring the 2 side corners together in the middle and pressing together

ingredients.element: spinach (could be one bunch or one bag of baby)
garlic cloves (divided as 3 whole and 2 finely chopped)
coconut milk (or could sub heavy cream)

steps.text: Blanch spinach in boiled water for 2-3 minutes. place in cold water right away
Add blanched spinach, tomatoes, 3 whole garlic cloves, jalapeno in blender and blend. Set aside
Cook 2 cloves of minced garlic and onion in 1 tbsp of oil until softened
add spinach mix and water to the pan and cook with lid on for 5 minutes tops (cooking more will cause browning)
blend mixture with a hand blender
add spices, coconut milk, sugar, and salt
prepare the paneer by adding cubes to boiled water for 1 minute then drain in cold water
add paneer to sauce and warm through
serve with lemon juice and fenugreek

ingredients.element: chole masala (spice mix that is yellow)

steps.text: Soak dry chickpeas overnight (or for at least 6+ hours) in 3 cups of water and set aside
Start instantpot in saute mode. Add oil, cumin seeds, bay leaves, ginger and garlic and then toast
add onions and saute for 3 minutes
Add tomato and all ground spices (except dry mango powder)
Drain chickpea soaking water, add chickpeas to instant pot along with 1.5 cups of water and then cook on high pressure for 35 mins with full natural release
Add dried feugreek and dry mango powder. place on saute mode and boil for about 2 minutes. May smash a bit for thicker gravy
add sugar and cream. top with cilantro

ingredients.element: oyster sauce (divided into 2 tbsp and 0.5 tbsp)

steps.text: Mix all the sauce ingredients (oyster sauce, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sugar and water) and set aside
stir fry veggies and shrimp separate with some oyster sauce, teriyaki sauce and mushroom powder
Stir fry onions, with udon noodles (prepared according to instructions) with sauce
prepare tofu by cubing, tossing with some udon sauce and air frying for about 10 minutes on air fry setting
mix everything together
Mix all dry ingredients together
Whisk eggs well, add rest of wet ingredients (including sugar) and mix to combine
mix dry into wet and gently combine
Bake at 350F for 1 hour in loaf pan
Place bacon on cold frying pan and then cook on low-medium until done. Drain out most of oil
cook bell pepper (diced) in the bacon oil. Scramble eggs in same pan at low heat and then remove
prepare potatoes by tossing cubed potatoes with oil and some salt and seasoning of choice (chili powder, cumin powder) and cook in air fryer at Roast Temp (375) for 15 minutes
Melt half of cheese on wrap (microwave for 15 minutes)
assemble: egg mixture, bacon strip, some potatoes then roll up
heat on frying pan for about 2 minutes each side to seal
serve with yogurt (sour cream) and salsa
dice all veggies
sauté garlic in oil in the instantpot, add all the other veggies (except cherry tomato) and cook until softened
add water to deglaze, add soy sauce and Italian seasoning and mix everything
on top: add tomato sauce and cherry tomato and DO NOT MIX
cook at high pressure for 10 minutes with 10 mins natural release
Add prepared pasta and stir to combine. Add about 1/4 cup grated parmesan
Mix all marinade together and then mix the chicken with marinade. Put in fridge for 30 minutes
line air fryer with aluminum foil.. raise edges so that marinade doesn't drain. Cook chicken in air fryer at 390F for 8-10 minutes
Serve chicken with pita, hummus, tzatziki, sliced veggies (tomato, cucumber), olives and feta cheese
Mix all sauce ingredients together (except for corn starch)
prepare udon noodles according to package
stir fry veggies (and protein) in veggie oil until cooked through  - add in some of sauce to coat and then remove from heat
In wok, add udon noodles and sauce and cook through. Add veggies and then add in corn starch (mixed with 1 tbsp of water) to combine
Brown chopped bacon in instant pot (in saute mode). Remove bacon to set aside. Remove half of the oil
Brown sausages (casing removed and chopped into pieces) and chopped onion and garlic until softened
Add in red pepper flakes, and thyme
deglaze pot with some of chicken stock
add 1 Tbsp fish sauce, rest of chicken stock and all of the potato cubes. Mix and then cook on high pressure for 5 mins with 10 mins natural release
Place on Saute mode, add in kale and tortellini and boil for about 5 mins (or until the pasta is cooked)
add Half-and-half , heat through and serve with chopped cooked bacon pieces
cook pasta ahead of time in salted water. Put in fridge to help dry it out (this allows for salad dressing to stick better to the pasta)
chop all veggies (And crab meat) into small pieces
prepare salad dressing mix as per instructions (with 4 tbsp of olive oil and 2 tbsp vinegar) along with some salt and some spices of choice (i used green goddess mix)
combine everything (pasta, mix ins and sauce)
Dry Fish with paper towel to remove moisture then cut into chunks
Mix marinade ingredients (paprika, garam masala, turmeric, ginger/garlic, lemon juice, greek yogurt and salt) . Coat fish chunks in marinade then put in fridge for 15 minutes
Make gravy by putting instant pot on sauté mode and cook whole cumin with butter. Add onions and ginger/garlic and fry until softened
add tomatoes and all spices (except for fenugreek) and 0.5 cup of water.
cook in instant pot at high pressure for 5 minutes with 5 mins natural release
blend the gravy with a hand blender and add in the cream and fenugreek
Make fish by cooking in air fryer (lined with aluminum foil) for 8 mins at 390F
Mix the fish into the gravy , add cilantro and stir to combine
mix dry ingredients together
Mix all wet ingredients (except zucchini and dark chocolate chunks)
mix wet with dry and then add zucchini and dark chocolate chunks to combine
bake at 360F for 50 minutes in a loaf pan
let cool for at least 15 minutes before slicing

ingredients.element: sausage (tuscan or could sub for more garlic sausage)

steps.text: pat chicken thighs dry with paper towel and then season both sides
place instant pot on saute mode and add oil, then brown both sides of chicken (about 3 minutes each) as well as shrimps  and remove from pot
dice all the veggies into small pieces. Mince garlic finely
saute sausage until brown and then add all the vegies until softened. Add in tomato paste and spices and saute until combined
pour in 1/2 cup of veggie stock to the instant pot and deglaze fully
add browned chicken to the pot and then on top, add rinsed jasmine rice, then 1.5 cups of veggie stock on top, ensuring all the rice is fully submerged in liquid
layer the diced tomatoes on top. DO NOT MIX (should be: veggies and chicken, rice, broth, tomatoes)
Cook at high pressure for 7 minutes with 10 minutes of natural release
add in shrimp and then mix to combine - may have to add salt to taste
Mince veggies very finely
rinse and dry beans
mix dressing ingredients together
combine everything into a bowl and serve with tortilla chips or add to your burritos

Combine beef stock , garlic, chipotles, onion, green chilis, lime juice, vinegar, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper and cloves in a blender or food processor.  Purée for 30 seconds, or until completely smooth.  Set aside
cut beef into chunks and then sear on instant pot in sauté mode for 45 seconds each side until browned.
add some of pureed sauce to deglaze. Then add all of the sauce and bay leaf and toss to combine
pressure cook at high pressure for 60 minutes followed by quick release
shred beef. Serve in either: taco form (with cheese, sautéed veggies or pickled red onions, cilantro and sliced avocado) or bowl form (fresh rice, refried beans, veggies and fresh salsa)
Dice onion, carrot and celery. Mince garlic. peel and cube potato
Sauté onions in butter and a pinch of salt in instant pot to sweat; add in minced garlic, thyme, bay leaf and other veggies (Except potato) and sauté until soft
deglaze pot with 1/2 cup of chicken stock
Add in : split peas, ham bone and the rest of the chicken stock, and potatoes and  stir to combine and ensure all the peas are submerged in liquid
Cook at high pressure for 15 minutes with 10 minutes natural release
Take out ham bone, shred off the meat and add the ham meat back into the instant pot. Season with 0.5-1 tsp of salt to taste (depends how salty your ham bone was)

title: Cauliflower and Yam taco with Chipotle Cream sauce

steps.text: Peel and cube yam; soak in water for about 10 minutes to remove starch and then towel dry
wash and dry cauliflower and then cut florets into bite size pieces
toss yam and cauliflower separately in 1 tbsp oil, 0.5 tsp of each ground spices, 0.5tsp of salt and place on lined baking sheet and bake at 425F for 22 minutes and then  broil for about 2 minutes
blend all sauce ingredients (yogurt, mayo, chipotle pepper, garlic clove, lime juice, 1 tsp olive oil, maple syrup and salt to taste) in blender until smooth
Serve yam and cauliflower with drizzled chipotle sauce on warmed tortilla with: cheese, black beans, shredded lettuce, tomato, salsa - lots of options!
Chop veggies into cubes, mince garlic
Dissolve bean paste into the water in a medium-large pot. Add all ingredients (except the shrimp) into the pot and bring to a boil then cook at medium-low heat for 15-20 minutes
Add in shrimp and let cook until shrimp is cooked (3 minutes)
blanch spinach in boiling water for 30 seconds, rinse in cold water and squeeze out excess water; mince/ cut into small pieces
combine in a bowl: spinach, ricotta cheese, pesto and egg. Stir until well combined and then put in fridge
Boil shells until just tender (a couple minutes less than package instructions). Drain and rinse in cold water
prepare pasta sauce: cook onion, garlic, mushrooms and ground turkey (could also use ground beef) in a pot and at end thrown in cherry tomatoes.
Spread about 1 cup of pasta sauce on bottom of large casserole dish
stuff each shell with about 2 Tbsp of cheese/ spinach filling and place in casserole dish. Top with the remaining of the pasta sauce and cook in a preheated oven at 350F for about 30 minutes.

Poach eggs: Boil water (half-full) in a shallow pot (wok is good) and add 1 Tbsp of vinegar when a gentle boil is reached. Carefully lower each egg (place each egg in a 1/3 measuring cup ) into the water and poach for about 4 minutes. Remove eggs from water with a slotted spoon and immediately place in cold water

Prepare hollandaise sauce according to instructions: Melt butter in small saucepan, add water and 1/2 of sauce packet and cook uncovered on high-medium heat for about 3 minutes until thickened. Keep whisking during process
Toast English muffin and top each half in the following order: Mashed/ sliced avocado, generous amount of crab meat, poached egg and then smoked salmon on top. Top with your hollandaise sauce
Serve with air fryer roast potatoes
Grate zucchini (about 1 medium) and squeeze out excess water
Mash bananas, whisk in all other wet ingredients (except the zucchini)-  eggs, melted butter, vanilla, sugar and Greek yogurt
Mix all dry ingredients together
Combine wet into dry, fold in zucchini (add optional chocolate chips - about 1/3 cup in desired) and divide into muffin cups
Bake at 350F for about 25 minutes
Mash Bananas and then whisk in very well the melted butter and sugar. Add in vanilla extract
mix together dry ingredients
Add Wet to dry and mix gently to barely combine (key to fluffy muffins) . At this point, add either blueberries or other add-ons  (walnuts, chocolate chips) . Scoop into 12 prepared muffin cups
Bake at 350F for 25 minutes

Roast Beets: Wash beets and cut off top and bottom then slice beets in half. Toss in some olive oil and salt and then lay out beets on a large piece of parchment paper and wrap in foil. Bake in preheated oven at 375F for 1 hour or until beets are tender. Once cooled, rub off the skin of beets using a paper towel or under cold water with gloves. Slice beets into pieces
prepare dressing: Whisk together apple cider vinegar, mustard and some salt and then drizzle in olive oil while whisking well.
To the greens in a bowl: crumble goat cheese, add in beets and toasted walnuts and then toss with your dressing
Mix all contents of sauce together - adjust salt to taste
dry salmon with paper towel
Place sauce on the SKIN side of the salmon and then place the salmon on a piece of parchment paper in airfryer
cook in air fryer for 390F for 8 mins
Peel potatoes and dice. Chop all veggies (broccoli florets, carrot and onion) and mince garlic cloves

Can either: sauté garlic, onion and carrot in butter in the instant pot, then deglaze, followed by adding in all other ingredients (except cheese and milk) OR if short on time, just dump in all ingredients (except milk and cheese) into the instant pot and mix to combine
Cook at HIGH pressure for 5 mins followed by 10 minutes of natural release
add in milk then blend with hand blender
Stir in cheese in handfuls.
Combine the sauce ingredients except sesame oil and seeds, and mix well
Rinse the chicken pieces, drain, and pat dry with paper towels.
Press the “Saute” button on the Instant Pot. When the pot is hot, add 1 tablespoon of canola or vegetable oil. Sear the pieces on both sides. Deglaze with 0.25 cup of water
Add in all vegies (cubed into fairly large chunks - no need to remove the skin on the squash or potatoes)
Pour the sauce over, and mix well to evenly coat the chicken and vegetables.
Cook at high pressure for 10 minutes with quick release
Set to sauté to reduce sauce to desired level

title: Korean Fried Chicken Sandwich with Kimchi

steps.text: prepare slaw: shred cabbage and carrot then mix with 1 Tbsp of mayo and salt to taste . Keep in fridge for flavour to develop

Make sauce: Prepare corn starch slurry by mixing 1 tsp of corn starch with 3 Tbsp of water and set aside. Add all sauce ingredients (rice wine vinegar, gochujang, honey, sesame oil, sugar, soy sauce, minced garlic clove, ginger) in a small sauce pan and bring to a boil, reduce heat and add the corn starch slurry and keep stirring until thickened. Remove from heat
Prep chicken: cut lengthwise to make 2 thinner filets with each breast. Pound lightly and salt lightly both sides and place in fridge for a couple hours to overnight

For each chicken filet: cover both sides in flour, then egg wash , then panko. Spray liberally with oil and cook in air fryer at 375F for 10 minutes, flip and spray the other side with oil and bake for another 7 minutes
To assemble: toast brioche bun, put some Japanese mayo on, slaw, chicken (covering both sides of chicken with your sauce) and followed by kimchi with juice squeezed out.
Whisk together all sauce ingredients
boil noodles according to instructions then rinse in cold water
chop all veggies into small thin pieces
mix all ingredients together and top with cilantro and crushed peanuts

title: Spaghetti squash with Pesto Rice and Sausage

steps.text: prepare spaghetti squash: cut in half and scoop out seeds. In an instant pot, place trivet and pour in 1 cup of water. Place squash halves in the instant pot and cook on high pressure for 8 minutes
Chop veggies (mushrooms, onion and tomato), mince garlic and cut sausage into bite sized pieces
In deep pan, add sausage to brown and add onion, garlic, mushroom and tomatoes and cook until softened, add rice, and pesto and stir until all well combined
Stuff prepared spaghetti squash with half of the rice/ sausage mixture and top with shredded cheese
Place halves on aluminum lined baking tray and bake at 375F for 25 minutes
Prepare chickpeas: soak in water and then cook in instant pot with 3 cups of water at high pressure for 16 minutes and then quick release.
Bake chickpeas: coat cooked chickpeas with 1 Tbsp of olive oil and seasoning (dill, salt and lemon and herb mix). Roast in oven at 375F for 25 minutes
prepare couscous according to instructions: add 1 cup of boiling water to 1 cup of couscous, cover for 5 minutes and then fluff
chop all veggies into small pieces: tomato (remove seeds and juice part), bell pepper, red onion and mince garlic
combine everything together and season with salt as needed
Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a cupcake/muffin pan with cupcake liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk together 1 1/4 cups flour, 1 1/4 tsp baking powder, and 1/2 tsp salt. Set flour mix aside.
In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter and sugar on medium-high speed 5 minutes until thick and fluffy, scraping down the bowl as needed.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well with each addition then scrape down the bowl. Add 2 tsp vanilla and beat to combine.

Reduce mixer speed to medium and add the flour mixture in thirds alternating with the buttermilk, mixing to incorporate with each addition. Scrape down the bowl as needed and beat until just combined and smooth, and don't overmix. Add crushed oreos and stir to combine
Divide batter into mini cupcake tins and bake between 9-15 minutes

prepare icing: beat butter on high speed for 5 minutes or until lightened in color and whipped, scraping down the bowl as needed, sift in powdered sugar while beating at medium-low speed, add vanilla extract and 1/3 cup of crushed oreo, add milk as needed to desired consistency
pipe each mini cupcake with some frosting and top each one with a mini oreo
mix all sauce ingredients (5 tbsp soy sauce, 2.5 tbsp of sesame oil, 4 tbsp sugar) together
Slice beef very thinly and then cook in wok very lightly with a couple spoons of prepared sauce. Remove from heat
slice all the veggies (onion, carrot, bell pepper, and mushroom) into thin pieces - then sauté them with a little bit of oil and some water until softened. Remove from heat

blanch washed spinach in boiling water for 1 minute , remove and rinse with cold water and then squeeze out the excess water. Mix spinach with the rest of sesame oil, some salt and sesame seeds. Set aside
Cook noodles according to instructions then drain
In a large wok, stir fry the noodles with the rest of sauce and oil and then add to a large mixing bowl.
To same mixing bowl, add all the cooked veggies and meat then stir to combine with gloves and top with sesame seeds
Mix marinade ingredients (lime juice, orange juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 garlic clove minced, 0.5 tsp cumin powder, salt)
Cut chicken breasts lengthwise into thinner halves and then salt both sides. Marinate chicken overnight
cook chicken: cook chicken in frying pan at medium -high heat for 4 mins each side, add some of the marinade to the pan and de glaze with some water. Remove and cover chicken to heat through

veggies: slice veggies into strips and lay on pan (with leftover chicken juice) and let cook undisturbed for one minute. Shake it up and repeat process 3 times (at the end, add some water and a pinch of salt along with some cumin, chili powder, paprika and oregano)
Cut chicken and add to a big bowl, add cooked veggies and toss along with a good squeeze of lime and chopped cilantro
When ready to serve, reheat everything in the pan
serve on tortilla , fresh salsa, guacamole, Greek yogurt/ sour cream and cheese
mix dry ingredients together (flour, baking powder, sugar, cocoa powder) in small bowl
Beat egg whites with milk and apple sauce in a separate bowl
stir wet and dry together lightly and then pour into a MUG that has been greased with a bit of cooking spray. Top with chocolate chips
Microwave for 50 seconds
let cool for a couple minutes and serve with fruit and cool whip
Cut tenderloin lengthwise into two halves
Combine the sugar, salt, five spice powder, white pepper, sesame oil, wine, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, molasses, food coloring (if using), and garlic in a bowl to make the marinade (i.e. the BBQ sauce)

Reserve about 2 tablespoons of marinade and set it aside. Rub the pork with the rest of the marinade in a large bowl or baking dish. Cover and refrigerate overnight, or at least 8 hours. Cover and store the reserved marinade in the fridge as well.

Line a sheet pan with foil and place a metal rack on top. Using the metal rack keeps the pork off of the pan.Place the pork on the rack, leaving as much space as possible between pieces. Pour 1 ½ cups water into the pan below the rack. This prevents any drippings from burning or smoking.

Preheat oven to 450F. combine the reserved marinade with the maltose or honey (maltose is very viscous––you can heat it up in the microwave to make it easier to work with) and 1 tablespoon hot water. This will be the sauce you’ll use for basting the pork.
Bake for 20minutes initially, Flip and baste with marinade - rotate tray
Bake at 375F for 10 Minutes. Flip and baste with marinade
bake at 375 for 7 minutes . Baste again
Finish by broiling for 3 minutes on each side at top rack
Remove from the oven and baste with the last bit of reserved BBQ sauce. Let the meat rest for 10 minutes before slicing, and enjoy!
place all ingredients into the instant pot and cook at high for 45 minutes with 15 minute natural release
shred pork using fork and place on baking sheet (lined with aluminum)
put some marinade on the pork and salt in necessary
broil at high for 5 minutes (or until crispy)
Serve as: tacos (tortilla, cilantro, cheese and pickled onions) , in burritos or even on a pizza with hot banana peppers
The night before, soak the dried chickpeas in water. Make sure the water covers the chickpeas by 2 to 3 inches, as they'll triple in size.
Drain and rinse the chickpeas and add them to your food processor, along with the onion, parsley, cilantro, pepper, garlic, cumin, salt, cardamom and black pepper.
Pulse the food processor several times until the mixture resembles the texture of coarse sand
Transfer the falafel mixture to a bowl and add the flour and baking soda. Stir together, then cover or add a lid and refrigerate the mixture for 30 minutes to one hour.
form falafel balls. (at this point - if not cooking right away, can transfer the falafel mixture into a ziplock bag to freeze)
Spray with oil and air fry at 350F for 14 minutes (flipping half way through)
Boil noodles according to package instructions (al dente as you will be stir frying them later)
Heat half of the oil in a wok and add the grown meat and cook until mostly browned - add some salt and a splash of the sauce
Add onion, garlic and mushroom and cook for a couple minutes. Add the bokchoy, green onion and shrimp  and cook until veggies are wilted. Remove this mixture from the wok
Heat rest of the oil in the wok and then at high heat, stir fry the noodles along with all of the sauce until well incorporated
To the wok of noodles, add back in all the cooked veggies and meat and stir to combine
top each serving with more black vinegar as desired.

ingredients.element: corn starch (mixed with 4 tbsp of water to make starch slurry)

steps.text: Prep veggies by dicing into small pieces. Mince garlic finely
Heat a large pan with 2 tablespoons of oil over medium high heat. Add the onion, 1/2 of the chopped scallion, garlic, and gochugaru, and stir-fry until fragrant, 2 - 3 minutes.
Add the meat, and cook until the meat is no longer pink, breaking up with a wooden spoon, 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the soy sauce, doenjang, gochujang, and sugar and stir to blend with the meat. Add the bell peppers and cook briefly until slightly softened.
Add 2 cups of water to the pan, and bring it to a boil
Add the tofu into the pan and cook for 15 minutes at a low simmer

Gently stir in the starch slurry to thicken the sauce, and then the sesame oil. Cook for another minute or so to bring everything together. Garnish with the remaining scallion, and serve hot with steamed rice.
blend all ingredients together until smooth
serve on toast with a poached/ fried egg and some feta cheese

Turn on the sauté function on your Instant Pot (to the default “Normal” — not high or low). Once hot, add water (or oil), onion, garlic, and ginger. Season with a healthy pinch each salt and pepper and stir. Sauté for 3-5 minutes, stirring frequently, or until onion is translucent and fragrant. Add a little bit more water as needed to prevent sticking

Add butternut squash and stir. Sauté for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently and adding a little more water as needed to prevent sticking (we added 2 Tbsp (30 ml)). Butternut squash should be slightly tender when pierced with a fork or knife
Turn off the sauté function by pressing “Cancel.” Then add red lentils, vegetable broth, water, turmeric, cinnamon, clove (optional), cayenne, and sea salt, and stir.

Put on the Instant Pot lid and turn to seal. Pressure cook on HIGH for 5 minutes (it will take about 5-10 minutes for the Instant Pot to pressurize before cooking begins). Once the timer goes off, let the steam release naturally (~15 minutes), or carefully press the quick release if in a hurry. Turn off the Instant Pot by pressing “Cancel.”
Carefully open the lid and add coconut milk and sugar (optional) and purée with an immersion blender until smooth
Leftovers will keep 4-5 days in the refrigerator or up to 1 month in the freezer. Reheat in a saucepan on the stovetop.

Heat the oil in a 12-inch heavy-bottomed sauté pan or medium-sized Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the cumin and coriander seeds for about 1 minute, tossing frequently, or until aromatic and darker by a few shades but don’t let them burn! Add the curry leaves and cook for 30 seconds

Add the onions with a big pinch of salt and cook for 5 minutes, until starting to get some color. If the spices start to darken, lower the heat to medium. Add a splash of water as needed to prevent onions from browning.
Add garlic and ginger, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add Ground Spices and tomato paste and stir frequently for 90 seconds. If it dries out, add a splash of water.
Add tomatoes + 2 teaspoons kosher salt. Use tomato juices to scrape up browned bits. Cook for 5 minutes, or until tomatoes are soft and the oil starts to release from them.
blend curry base using an immersion blender.
Pour in chickpeas, coconut milk, water, tahini, and sugar. Stir well and bring to a simmer. Cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, opening the pot to stir occasionally.
After the simmer time, add the greens. Simmer until tender and wilted, 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in the garam masala to combine.
Off the heat, squeeze in a little lemon or lime juice and cilantro. Season to taste with salt (about ½ teaspoon kosher salt).
Chop green onion super finely. Chop kimchi into small pieces
Boil noodles according to package instructions until al dente and then immediately wash in cold water and drain.
To large bowl, add in kimchi, noodles, green onion and all sauce ingredients. Mix and then add the seaweed by crumbling it in with your hands
top with more green onion as desired along with 2 boiled eggs
boiled eggs: put eggs into a small pot, cover and cook at high until boiling. Reduce heat to medium and then continue boiling for 5 minutes. Immediately place in cold water and peel.
Potatoes (instant pot)
Place peeled and sliced potatoes into the bottom of the instant pot. Cover with 3 cups of water and cook on manual pressure for 8 minutes with quick release
Drain potatoes and return to instant pot. Add the remainder of ingredients (adding in the milk as needed) and mash. Set aside
Fillng
Set lentils to cook in salted water (unless cooked already – and you could absolutely do this ahead) about 20-25 minutes (see notes) simmer until tender, but not falling apart, al dente.

In a large pot, heat the butter over medium high heat and saute the onion 2-3 minutes, lower heat to med, add garlic, saute 2 minutes, add veggie grounds, carrots and mushrooms and  cook 5-7 minutes. Add salt, cumin, coriander, fenugreek leaves and garam masala.

Add broth. Bring to a simmer, cover and simmer on med low, until carrots are cooked through about 7-8 minutes.

MAKE THE GRAVY: Over medium heat, in a little pot, simmer the whole seeds ( cumin seeds and fennel seeds)  in ghee or oil until fragrant and golden. Add flour, whisking, stirring and toasting the flour one minute. Gradually whisk in the warm veggie broth. Cook until slightly thickened. Add this gravy to the filling, along with the peas, corn and drained lentils. Mix to combine

The filling should have  thick stew-like, saucy consistency. If too dry, add a splash of broth or water. If too watery, simmer off some of that liquid. If the filling is too watery, the mashed potatoes will sink.
Assembly
Assemble: In a large oven proof dish, place all the filling in and spread to flatten. Then add mashed potatoes (big dallops at a time on top and spread out with the back of a spoon.
Place in the oven until golden and bubbling, about 20-25 minutes. Feel free to brown the top under a broiler.
Chop all veggies - dice onion and mushroom, shred carrot finely and mince garlic cloves
In a large saucepan, cook onion and garlic in oil and add the veggie grounds and dark soy sauce. Add mushrooms and carrots and cook until everything is softened
Add in pasta sauce and seasoning ( chili flakes, oregano, italiano, salt and parmesan) and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add in cooked rotini, ravioli and handful of spinach and heat through until spinach is wilted
Sauce

Prepare sauce packet according to instructions: Combine sauce mix, milk, half-and-half and 2 tbsp of butter into a medium saucepan and bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes
Add 1 cup of tomato sauce to the Alfredo mix, and stir in parmesan cheese. Mix until combined and set aside
Pasta
In a large saucepan, heat olive oil with onion and garlic and cook for a few minutes.
Add in other veggies (mushroom and zucchini) and cook until softened.
Near the end, add in shrimp and cook until heated through.
Boil pasta (can use either the whole rotini box or half rotini/ half tortellini)
Add pasta to the pot of veggies/ shrimp and then add in the sauce and stir through to combine

ingredients.element: tamarind juice (1.5 tbsp of paste with 3 tbsp of water)

steps.text: Peel and cut yellow potatoes and carrot - steam in a steamer until softened and set aside

Salt and pepper the skin of the chicken and then pan fry then in a wok for about 3 minutes on each side until crispy. Take out the chicken and add the whole can of coconut milk to the wok and heat until boiling
Add the chicken back into the wok of coconut milk, reduce heat to medium-low, put on the lid and simmer for 20 minutes (flipping the chicken at half way point)

In a separate pot: Add 1 cup of coconut cream and heat until separated. Add the massaman paste and heat until mixed through. Add this to the chicken mixture (along with the spices and tamarind juice  and fish sauce)
Lastly, in a small frying pan, stir fry the onion and chopped green beans until softened
Combine all the components into the wok with the chicken and sauce: steamed veggies and the stir fried onion and green beans
served topped with crushed roasted peanuts (un-salted)
Dice and steam the cauliflower and carrot until softened. Set aside
In a large wok, heat oil and then add the aromatics (minced garlic and ginger) , curry paste and spices (garam massala, cumin, turmeric and coriander) and diced onion and heat through.
Add the rest of the veggies (mushroom, zucchini) and cook until slightly softened - should still have a bite to them
Add in the coconut milk and diced tofu and then stir to combine. Simmer for 10 minutes until tofu and veggies are cooked
Add in cauliflower and carrots and then stir to combine. Serve on top of rice
Drain and rinse black beans - add to a bowl with the corn.
Finely dice the onion, mince the garlic, and roughly chop the cilantro.
Add the onion, garlic, cilantro, shredded cheddar, and taco seasoning to the bowl with the beans and corn. Stir until everything is evenly combined and coated in seasoning.

Place a half cup of the filling on one side of each tortilla and fold over. Cook the quesadillas in a skillet over medium heat on each side until brown and crispy and the cheesy filling has melted. Slice into triangles then serve.

o freeze the quesadillas, stack the filled and uncooked quesadillas with a piece of parchment paper between each quesadilla. Place in a freezer bag and freeze for up to three months. To reheat either microwave (for a soft quesadilla) or cook in a skillet on low heat (make sure to use low heat so that the filling has time to thaw and melt before the outside burns).
Variations: Sub half of the black beans with other proteins: chopped chicken breast, scrambled eggs etc.

title: Kale Caesar Salad with Parmesan Chickpeas Sweet Potatoes

steps.text: Sweet Potatoes: peel and dice sweet potatoes , soak in water for about 10 minutes - combine with 1 tbsp of olive oil, 1 tsp chili powder , 1 tsp paprika and salt.Toss well to evenly coat. Transfer to the oven and roast for 20 minutes.
Kale: wash and massage kale with some salt, the lemon juice and olive oil.
chickpeas: toss chickpeas with oil and seasoning then pan fry them until heated and crispy.
Dressing:Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper.
Toss the roasted sweet potatoes and chickpeas in with the salad. Add the dressing and toss to combine.
In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, and sugar. In a separate bowl grate zucchini and squeeze any excess water out.
In a separate bowl, beat together eggs, bananas, oil, and vanilla extract.
combine wet into dry
Fold in grated zucchini and chocolate chips.
Pour batter into a well-oiled loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for about 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.  Add onion, pepper, cilantro and salt. Lightly cook until the onion is translucent
Add the beans with broth and toss with the spices and oil. Add the Salsa Lizano.
Add the cooked rice to the skillet and toss until well combined with the beans and spices. Heat thoroughly and serve- preferably with fried eggs,
whisk dry ingredients together

beat eggs and add melted butter, sugar, milk and vanilla extract and whisk well (important to incorporate the eggs and melted butter together well and gradually whisk the milk in to avoid separation of the butter fat solids)
gently fold in dry into wet and add blueberries to incorporate
cook on medium heat with some butter
Chop onions, bell pepper and tomatoes. Mince garlic finely. Drain beans and corn.

To a pan, heat oil and stir fry onion and garlic; add the sausages (chopped and skin removed) and stir fry for a few minutes. Add bell pepper and cook until vegetables are softened and sausage is cooked. Add spices (chilli powder, cumin, paprika, and chipotle pepper adobo sauce) and drained beans and corn and mix throughout
In a separate pan, scramble eggs until barely cooked and then transfer eggs into the wok of veggies/ sausage. At this point, add the diced tomatoes and mix. Taste and season with salt as necessary.

To assemble: place some enchilada sauce at the bottom of an oven proof pan. For each enchilada: place a few tbsp of sauce on the tortilla to moisten and then add filling and top with some cheese. Roll up the enchilada and place in the pan with the fold side down. Repeat until all are assembled, top with the last of enchilada sauce and then cheese.
Bake uncovered at 350F for 20 minutes followed by a 2-5 minute broil
Chicken
Pound and make slits on chicken breast. Salt both sides and let sit in fridge while you make the yogurt marinade
Combine all listed ingredients above to make the marinade. Marinate the chicken in the mixture and let sit in the fridge for a minimum of 4 hours
Air fry the chicken on aluminum foil at 390F for 8 minutes on each side or until 160F internal temperature is reached
cover the chicken in aluminum and set aside while you make the gravy. When ready, chop into bite sized pieces
Sauce

In an instant pot, saute ginger, garlic, thai chili and onion with the butter and salt for a few minutes until softened. Add in spices and toast for a  minute to bring out the fragrance  then deglaze with the water (0.5 to 0.75 cup)
Add chopped tomatoes, DO NOT STIR, cover and pressure cook on high for 5 minutes with 5 minutes natural release
Puree the sauce
Add in the whipping cream, cilantro, fennelgreek, sugar and chicken pieces  and heat through.
Place instant pot on saute mode: add oil, minced garlic, onion and bell pepper and cook until veggies are softened
Add all the spices and salt along with the rinsed rice and cook until toasty.
Deglaze with the broth (or water if you don't have broth)  - add the rest of the broth and frozen peas and make sure all the rice is submerged in the water
Add tomato paste on top and DO NOT MIX
Pressure cook on high for 6 minutes with 10 minute natural release
Fluff rice, add lime juice and chopped cilantro and serve.
Enchilada sauce

Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour and cook for 1 minute, whisking constantly.  Add in the chili powder, garlic powder, cumin and oregano and cook for 1 more minute, whisking constantly.

Gradually pour in the stock, whisking constantly to combine until no lumps remain.  Continue cooking until the sauce reaches a simmer.  Then reduce heat to medium-low to maintain the simmer (the sauce should continue lightly bubbling) for about 10-15 minutes, uncovered, until the sauce has slightly thickened.
Give the sauce a taste and season with salt, as needed. Makes enough sauce for 2 servings
Instant pot Chicken
Add all ingredients (except for salsa) into instant pot and mix to combine
add salsa on top and then seal and cook on high pressure for 8 minutes with quick release
Shred chicken mixture
Enchilada filling
Heat oil in wok and then add garlic clove, diced chipotle pepper and onion and cook until a bit softened. Add bell pepper and mushroom and cook until veggies are softenend.
Add in shredded chicken mixture and halved cherry tomatoes. Season with salt as needed (should be not too salty as will be adding enchilada sauce and cheese)
Assembly
Place about ½ cup of enchilada sauce into the bottom of an oven proof cooking pan and spread to cover.

For each enchilada: take a tortilla and place about 1 tbsp of enchilada sauce on to moisten, add enchilada filling and then a little bit of cheese, roll up and then place into the cooking pan fold side down.
Cover enchiladas with sauce and then top with remaining cheese
Bake uncovered at 350F for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Broil for about 2 minutes on high. Serve with chopped cilantro on top.
Shred zucchini and cook with oats and water in a medium saucepan for 5 minutes on a medium boil
add mlk and mix until thick
add egg whites and keep mixing until fluffy (1 minute)
add half of banana (mashed), sweetener of choice (1 tbsp of sugar or 2 tsp of splenda) , cinnamon and peanut butter powder
mix until combined and  top with blueberries and peanut butter or more sliced banana (optional)
Shred zucchini and cook with oats and water in a medium saucepan for 5 minutes on a medium boil
add mlk and mix until thick
add egg whites and keep mixing until fluffy (1 minute)
Add sweetener of choice (1 tbsp of sugar or 2 tsp of splenda) ,  peanut butter powder and cocoa powder
mix until combined and  top with maple syrup, walnuts and almond butter
Make tuna: thaw tuna and chop into very small pieces and mix with the marinade of choice and put in fridge for about 15 minutes
Make slaw: Slice the veggies into thin matchsticks and mix with the marinade and keep in fridge until read to use (10 minutes)
Spicy crab mix: mix ingredients together until combined (if making it non-spicy, simply omit the sriracha)

Assemble for each bowl: place 100 gm of cooked sushi rice at bottom of bowl, top with: sashimi tuna, crab mixture, veggie slaw, one-half of an avocado sliced and optional toppings (tempura, fruit, edamame, kewpie mayo, crumbled seaweed)
Sauce: blend all ingredients together and set aside
Vegetables: shred carrot and beets finely
sweet potato: peel and cube into small pieces - coat with olive oil and salt and then air fry or bake in oven until done
rice: cook as per usual but add 1 tsp of turmeric powder into the cooking water for a nice yellow colour
Quinoa: rinse and cook in an instant pot with 1.5 cups of water for 3 minutes on high pressure with 10 minutes of natural release. Fluff and set aside
Tomatoes: Mix whole cherry tomatoes with olive oil and salt and then cook in air fryer at 390F for 15 minutes
Vegetables: de-seed the cucumber and dice all veggies into small pieces
Dressing: mince the garlic and mix all components until well combined
Assemble: add all components to a large bowl , add in dressing then mix to combine.
Preheat oven to 350 F
Cream all wet ingredients (softened butter, 1 egg, vanilla extract, sugar) until well combined
Mix dry into wet
Stir in oats, walnuts (optional) and chocolate chips
Form 24 balls and place on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper  and bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes
Cookies
Cream together butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.

Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour, baking powder, and salt. Cover, and chill dough for at least 1 hour (or overnight).
Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour, baking powder, and salt. Cover, and chill dough for at least 1 hour (or overnight).
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F
Lightly dust a work surface with flour. Roll out dough to 1/4 to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter. Place cookies 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are lightly browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Carefully transfer cookies to a wire rack and cool completely before decorating.
Icing
In a large bowl, combine powdered sugar (1 ¾ cups), milk (3 tablespoons), vanilla extract (1 teaspoon), almond extract (½ teaspoon), and salt (¼ teaspoon).
Use a rubber spatula to stir mixture until smooth.
The consistency should be thick enough that it won't run off cookies, but thin enough that the icing "melts" back in on itself when you drizzle a spoonful over the bowl.
Tip: If your icing looks too dry, add 1 teaspoon of milk until it looks like the consistency in the video. If it is too thin, add 1 tablespoon of powdered sugar
Cookies
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F

Beat butter and white sugar together in a medium bowl until creamy. Mix in 0.25 teaspoon almond extract. Add flour and (optional - add toasted coconut) mix until dough comes together. OPTIONAL: at this point, chill the dough
Form dough into 1 1/2-inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Use your thumb to press down and make a dent in the center of each ball, then fill with jam.
Bake in batches the preheated oven until edges are lightly browned, about 14 to 18 minutes; allow to cool on cookie sheet for a few minutes.
Glaze
Mix confectioners' sugar, milk, and remaining 0.25 teaspoon almond extract together in a medium bowl until smooth; drizzle lightly over warm cookies.

Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed until mostly incorporated, 1 to 2 minutes. Increase speed to medium-high and beat until light and fluffy, another 2 to 3 minutes. Beat in egg yolk, then molasses.
To wet: Beat in egg yolk, then molasses.
Whisk sifted flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, and nutmeg in a separate bowl until well combined.
Gradually add flour mixture to the molasses mixture, beating until well blended and smooth.
Divide dough in half and form each into a 1-inch-thick disk. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 to 3 hours, or overnight
When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F

Working with one disk at a time, and leaving remaining disk in the refrigerator, unwrap chilled dough and place on a lightly floured surface. Working from the center to the edges, roll dough with a floured rolling pin to a thickness of 1/4 inch.

Cut dough into desired shapes with cookie cutters, dipping the cutters into flour as needed so they don't stick to the dough. Fit the cookie cutters as closely together as possible to cut as many cookies as you can. This will minimize the number of times you have to re-roll the dough
Bake each sheet in the preheated oven until firm, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool
Frost or decorate cooled gingerbread cookies as desired.
Start the instant pot in sauté mode and heat the butter in it. Add cumin seeds, green chili, curry leaves, and garlic
After the garlic turns light brown, add the chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes until the onions turn golden brown.
Add tomato and spices and cook for another 2 minutes. Splash some of the water in to help deglaze and prevent burning
Add the washed dal and water. Stir it all up
pressure cook mode at high pressure for for 5 mins. After the instant pot beeps, let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes, then release the pressure manually
Garnish with cilantro and stir. Optionally, sprinkle the juice of half a lemon. Dal tadka is ready to be served.
Whisk all ingredients together in a small bowl, or shake together in a jar, until smooth and emulsified.
This dressing can be kept in the fridge for about one month.
Uses: Buddha bowl
Pickled carrots
Combine the pickle brine in a saucepan and boil on medium heat until the sugar dissolves (3 to 4 minutes). Stir occasionally. Remove from the heat and cool it down.

Place the julienned carrots into a sterile pickling jar and pour over the brine. Close the lid. Gently move the jar around a little bit to make sure the brine is touching the all radishes and carrots.
Leave the jar at room temperature for 3 to 4 hours then move to the fridge. Chill the pickles for 30 mins to 1 hour before serving for optimal taste.
Air Fryer Tofu
Press tofu for 30 minutes to draw out excess moisture . Cube into pieces
In a medium size bowl place the pressed and cubed tofu. Add in liquid aminos and toss to coat. Add in all of the other seasoning ingredients including the oil and toss to thoroughly combine.

Place in your air fryer in a single row, so that all the tofu has a little bit of space around each piece. Set your air fryer to 400°F. Cook for 10 minutes, shaking the basket after 5 minutes, then continuing to cook.
Assembly
Crisp up chickpeas in a frying pan with some oil and spices of choice

Each bowl: place ½ cup of cooked quinoa at bottom of bowl, then top with one portion of crispy tofu, some pickled carrot, ¼ cup edamame, ¼ cup corn,½ cup of chickpeas,¼ cup chopped cucumber, cilantro, cashew and drizzle with a serving of prepared Miso-Ginger dressing
